name: Side-lying External Rotation
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your side with your feet touching, keeping your feet and hips in a straight line. Place the top arm (for example, your right arm) on your hip, palm facing downwards.
2. Place your bottom leg across the top leg, forming an L-shape with your legs.

3. As you perform this exercise, keep both shoulders relaxed and down from ears, maintaining a natural arch in your lower back.

4. Rotate your top arm, keeping it close to your body, so that your hand is facing away from your body and across the bottom leg.

5. Focus on squeezing your shoulder and rotating at the glenohumeral joint (shoulder joint). Hold for 1-2 seconds, then slowly return to starting position.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions or sets.
short_summary: Side-lying external rotation is a unilateral upper body exercise that targets the rotator cuff, specifically the deltoids and subscapularis muscles, helping improve shoulder stability.
